content: this is a summary of a legal case that took place on november 24th 2016 the case involves two parties referred to as o and a who are involved in a cassation court case the court dismissed the plaintiffs claim for an occupancy allowance stating that there was no legal basis for it especially considering the defendants responsibility for hosting their common children the court also dismissed the pleas contention regarding the violation of res judicata due to the inadmissibility of uncertified copies of previous judgments objections concerning the assessment of occupancy contributions and the recognition of the childrens occupation and parental contribution were also deemed inadmissible the court upheld some aspects of the plea while dismissing others based on the legal merits presented the decision was based on various articles of the civil code and the judicial code the case is represented by the applicant in the cassation court who argues that the courts decision violates various legal provisions and principles the applicant concludes by requesting that the court quash the judgment and remit the case to another court of appeal
